abstract: The board of Capital Shopping Centers said the $4.8 billion offer “very substantially” undervalued the company and its prospects.
snippet: The board of Capital Shopping Centers said the $4.8 billion offer “very substantially” undervalued the company and its prospects.
lead_paragraph: 7:52 p.m. | Updated The board of Capital Shopping Centers of Britain rebuffed a $4.8 billion overture on Wednesday from the American developer Simon Property, the latest development in the highly contentious mating dance between the two mall owners.

headline.main: British Mall Owner Rejects Simon Property’s Bid
